service_overview.description: GlobusTelecom eSIM is a single, global prepaid eSIM that provides internet access in multiple countries. It's a one-time purchase without the need for country-specific packages or plans.
key_features: One single eSIM for global coverage.
Pay-as-you-go model with low rates per GB.
The eSIM itself remains active indefinitely, provided it is used at least once every two years.
Automatic and manual selection of network operators in most countries for best connectivity.
Unrestricted Internet access via European gateway.

google: Google Pixel 3 (not including phones bought in Australia, Taiwan or Japan. Phones bought with United States or Canadian carriers other than Sprint and Google Fi do not work with eSIM)
Google Pixel 3a (not including phones bought in Japan or with Verizon service)
Google Pixel 2 (only phones bought with Google Fi service)
other_phones: Vivo V29 Lite 5G (eSIM supported only in Europe)

steps: Go to the 'Buy eSIM' page at https://globustele.com/#x-plan.
Click the 'BUY NOW' button.
Register for a new account or log in to your existing one. Registration requires your name, email, and a password, followed by email verification.
Complete the payment using a bank card via our secure Stripe payment gateway.
After a successful purchase, your new eSIM details will be available in your personal account dashboard.
account_data: Phone Number (for secondary type eSIMs, otherwise empty)

steps: Go to Settings / Connections / Cellular (Mobile) on your phone
Select **SIM card manager** and **Add mobile plan**
Tap on **Add using QR code**
Scan your QR code. A pop up will appear,**Add new mobile plan?** Tap on **Add**
A second pop up will appear, **Add new mobile plan?**Tap on **OK**
Your new data plan will be displayed in your eSIMs list

For certain eSIMs you might need to check your APN settings. The details on how to set your APN are included in the eSIM installation instructions SMS that you will receive after purchasing your eSIM and installing it into your phone.
tips: With the latest versions of iOS you can just scan the QR code with your iPhone Camera application. It will ask if you want to install a new plan. With other phones, to scan the QR code, follow the steps below on your device:
The QR code is for single use only and can install the eSIM on one device.
Do not delete the eSIM profile from your device after installation, as it cannot be re-installed with the same QR code.

steps: If you are experiencing issues scanning the QR code or receive the QR code on the device you are using, there is another option on your device that will allow you to enter details manually. You will be asked to enter:
Go to your device's Settings > Cellular/Mobile Data > Add eSIM/Add Cellular Plan.
Select the option to enter details manually.
Copy the 'SM-DP+ server' address and 'eSIM activation code' from your GlobusTelecom account and paste them into the respective fields.
Follow the on-screen instructions to complete.
On your Apple device, click the 'Apple Simple Install URL' provided in your GlobusTelecom account.
Your device will automatically prompt you to add the cellular plan.
Tap 'Continue' and follow the on-screen instructions to finalize the installation.
tips: This is an alternative installation method specifically for Apple devices.
It is useful if QR code or manual installation methods do not work.

post_installation: Ensure 'Data Roaming' is turned ON for your GlobusTelecom eSIM in your phone's settings to connect to the internet.
installation.apn_settings: APN (Access Point Name) settings are typically configured automatically. Manual setup is not required for most devices.

no_connection_fix: 1. Check that 'Data Roaming' is enabled for your GlobusTelecom eSIM.
3. Manually select a network operator: Go to Settings > Cellular/Mobile Data > Network Selection, turn off 'Automatic', and choose a different available carrier from the list.

common_problems.problem: QR code already used or invalid
common_problems.solution: The installation QR code can only be used once. If the installation failed, you accidentally deleted the eSIM, or the code is not working, please contact support for assistance.
Ensure you are entering the correct IMSI (or phone number for secondary eSIMs). The minimum top-up amount is 5 USD. If issues persist, please contact support.

roaming_setup: To ensure your connection to the Global Mobile Data network you must switch your Roaming and Data Roaming settings on. You can find the Roaming switch in your smartphone Settings. For certain eSIMs you might need to check your APN settings. The details on how to set your APN are included in the eSIM installation instructions SMS that you will receive after purchasing your eSIM and installing it into your phone.
coverage_issues: You might find it difficult to access the Internet in areas with limited mobile coverage or no coverage at all. Try switching locations and make sure you have enough signal bars to connect to 3G, 4G / LTE or 5G. You can also try to change the carrier manually. If you are in good coverage and tried everything else, you can always try a full power-down restart and see if that helps.

balance_check.method: Dial *187# in your Phone application and wait for the operator message with your actual balance.
Check your 'Current Balance' in your personal account dashboard on the globustele.com website.

steps: Go to the top-up page at https://globustele.com/#x-topup.
Enter the IMSI of your eSIM (found in your account dashboard). For some eSIMs, you may need to enter a phone number instead.
Enter the amount in USD you wish to add (minimum is 5 USD).
Click 'TOP UP' and complete the payment with your bank card via Stripe.

features: Complete privacy - no user data collection
advantages: 1. SIM Toolkit attack. Using a special service SMS and a secret Ki key an attacker can control a subscriber’s SIM card (or eSIM chip) and, using a special surveillance interface built into every GSM phone, eavesdrop on the subscriber during calls or standby.
3. Log the subscriber’s calls, messages and data sessions
protection_details: A new IMEI is generated every time you install a new eSIM. We have no information on the security of these generated IMEI codes, whether it is possible to infer or retrieve the original IMEI or not. But at least it is not the same.

methods: Bank Card (Visa, MasterCard, etc.) processed securely through Stripe.
payment.currency: All transactions are processed in USD.

contact_methods.details: For instant answers and troubleshooting. If the bot cannot solve your problem, it can forward your message to a human agent in the support chat.

support.response_time: We do not have a guaranteed response time, but our team strives to address all queries as quickly as possible.
